author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: There are many ways to achieve the same goal.

author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: It's easier to talk about doing something than to actually do it.

text: Den Apel fält nét weit vum Bâm.
author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Children often resemble their parents in behavior or characteristics.

author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: In urgent situations, people may disregard rules or conventions.

author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: People may act dishonestly if given the chance.

author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Being overly greedy can lead to losing everything.

text: Den éischte Frënd ass de beschte Frënd.
author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Long-standing friendships are invaluable.

text: Déi zwéi Kinnekskanner, déi sech gär haten, koumen net beieneen.
author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Even those destined for each other may face insurmountable obstacles.

text: Et ass kee Prophet an sengem eegene Land unerkannt.
author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: People's talents or insights are often unappreciated by those close to them.

author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Everyone, regardless of size or status, has significance.

author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Being kind doesn't require much effort but has great value.

text: Mat Gedold an Zäit gëtt d'Miel zum Brout.
author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Patience leads to fruitful outcomes.

author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Life isn't always easy; challenges are part of it.

text: Ouni Käschte gëtt et keng Gewënn.
author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Achieving something valuable often requires sacrifices.

author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Kindness and flattery can achieve a lot.

text: Wou d'Uelzecht durech d'Wisen zéit, do ass onst Land.
author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: A poetic reference to Luxembourg's landscape and heritage.

author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Too many people involved can ruin a project.

author: Benjamin Franklin (Translated to Luxembourgish)
meaning: Time is a valuable resource.

text: Wie net wëllt héieren, muss fillen.
author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Ignoring advice can lead to consequences.

text: Wou eng Wëll ass, ass och e Wee.
author: Luxembourgish Proverb
meaning: Determination can overcome obstacles.
